languages.text: Этой ночью Лорд-капитана и некоторых обитателей корабля разбудили звуки прекрасной музыки. Мелодия ласкала слух... пока все затронутые не осознали, что источник звука — их собственное тело. Казалось, что маленькие молоточки выстукивают стаккато на зубах, невидимые пальцы щипками заставляют сухожилия звучать как струны, неощутимое дыхание наполняет кости, превращая их в тоскливо поющие флейты. Наваждение закончилось, но еще долго каждое движение заставляло сердца замирать в ожидании, не зазвучат ли эти струны и флейты вновь.

That night, the Lord Captain and some of {mf|his|her} crew were awakened by beautiful music. The sound seemed to caress their very minds... until they realised that the source was their own bodies. While their teeth were chattering out a staccato, their tendons were being plucked like strings by unseen hands, and invisible breaths flowed through their bones, turning them into mournful flutes. The illusion ended, but for a long time afterward, every movement made their hearts stutter in fear — was the orchestra about to strike up once more?
languages.original_text: Этой ночью Лорд-капитана и некоторых обитателей корабля разбудили звуки прекрасной музыки. Мелодия ласкала слух... пока все затронутые не осознали, что источник звука — их собственное тело. Казалось, что маленькие молоточки выстукивают стаккато на зубах, невидимые пальцы щипками заставляют сухожилия звучать как струны, неощутимое дыхание наполняет кости, превращая их в тоскливо поющие флейты. Наваждение закончилось, но еще долго каждое движение заставляло сердца замирать в ожидании, не зазвучат ли эти струны и флейты вновь.

traits.locale_text: Lord-captain and some of his crew were awakened by a beautiful melody that caressed their minds... until they realised that the instrument it was played on was their own body. Their own teeth were chattering staccato, their sinews were pulled by invisible hands as if they were strings, their bones were used as flutes. The apparition soon disappeared, but for a while each body movement cause fear that the haunting melody of sinew and bone might be heard again.

Lord-captain and some of his crew were awakened by a beautiful melody that caressed their minds... until they realised that the instrument it was played on was their own body. Their own teeth were chattering staccato, their sinews were pulled by invisible hands as if they were strings, their bones were used as flutes. The apparition soon disappeared, but for a while each body movement cause fear that the haunting melody of sinew and bone might be heard again.

The Lord Captain and some of his crew were awakened by a beautiful melody caressing their very minds... until they realized that the instrument it was played on was their own body. Their own teeth were chattering staccato, their tendons were being pulled by unseen hands as if they were strings, invisible breaths played their bones like morbid flutes. The apparitions soon disappeared, but for a while each body movement caused fear that the haunting melody of tendon and bone might be heard again.

The apparitions soon disappeared, but for a while each body movement caused fear that the haunting melody of tendon and bone might be heard again.

While their teeth were chattering out a staccato, their tendons were being plucked like strings by unseen hands, and invisible breaths flowed through their bones, turning them into mournful flutes. The illusion ended, but for a long time afterward, every movement made their hearts stutter in fear — was the orchestra about to strike up once more?

That night, the Lord Captain and some of {mf|his|her} crew were awakened by beautiful music. The sound seemed to caress their very minds... until they realised that the source was their own bodies. While their teeth were chattering out a staccato, their tendons were being plucked like strings by unseen hands, and invisible breaths flowed through their bones, turning them into mournful flutes. The illusion ended, but for a long time afterward, every movement made their hearts stutter in fear — was the orchestra about to strike up once more?

languages.text: 某天晚上，舰长大人与{mf|他|她}一部分船员被美妙的音乐声唤醒。音乐声似乎在爱抚着他们的心灵……直到他们意识到，音乐声是从他们自己的身体中发出来的。他们的牙齿格格作响，仿佛断断续续的演奏。肌腱仿佛琴弦一样，被某只看不见的手拨动。无形的呼吸流经他们的骨头，仿佛在吹奏着充满哀伤的笛声。在那之后，幻觉结束了，但在接下来很长一段时间里，每当船员们想要做些什么的时候，他们的灵魂都在恐惧中颤抖——那古怪的管弦乐声是否会再次响起？
languages.original_text: That night, the Lord Captain and some of {mf|his|her} crew were awakened by beautiful music. The sound seemed to caress their very minds... until they realised that the source was their own bodies. While their teeth were chattering out a staccato, their tendons were being plucked like strings by unseen hands, and invisible breaths flowed through their bones, turning them into mournful flutes. The illusion ended, but for a long time afterward, every movement made their hearts stutter in fear — was the orchestra about to strike up once more?

traits.locale_text: 某天晚上，舰长大人与{mf|他|她}一部分船员被美妙的音乐声唤醒。音乐声似乎在爱抚着他们的心灵……直到他们意识到，音乐声是从他们自己的身体中发出来的。他们的牙齿格格作响，仿佛断断续续的演奏。肌腱仿佛琴弦一样，被某只看不见的手拨动。无形的呼吸流经他们的骨头，仿佛在吹奏着充满哀伤的笛声。在那之后，幻觉结束了，但在接下来很长一段时间里，每当船员们想要做些什么的时候，他们的灵魂都在恐惧中颤抖——那古怪的管弦乐声是否会再次响起？

languages.text: Esa noche, {mf|el|la} Lord Capitán y su tripulación despertaron por el sonido de una música maravillosa. El sonido parecía acariciar sus mentes... hasta que se dieron cuenta de que el origen de la música era sus propios cuerpos. Mientras sus dientes castañeteaban en stacatto, unas manos invisibles tocaban sus tendones como cuerdas y un hálito espectral recorría sus huesos, convirtiéndolos en flautas fúnebres. La ilusión terminó, pero durante mucho tiempo cada movimiento llenó de temor sus corazones. ¿Estaba la orquesta a punto de empezar otro movimiento?
languages.original_text: That night, the Lord Captain and some of {mf|his|her} crew were awakened by beautiful music. The sound seemed to caress their very minds... until they realised that the source was their own bodies. While their teeth were chattering out a staccato, their tendons were being plucked like strings by unseen hands, and invisible breaths flowed through their bones, turning them into mournful flutes. The illusion ended, but for a long time afterward, every movement made their hearts stutter in fear — was the orchestra about to strike up once more?

traits.locale_text: Esa noche, {mf|el|la} Lord Capitán y su tripulación despertaron por el sonido de una música maravillosa. El sonido parecía acariciar sus mentes... hasta que se dieron cuenta de que el origen de la música era sus propios cuerpos. Mientras sus dientes castañeteaban en stacatto, unas manos invisibles tocaban sus tendones como cuerdas y un hálito espectral recorría sus huesos, convirtiéndolos en flautas fúnebres. La ilusión terminó, pero durante mucho tiempo cada movimiento llenó de temor sus corazones. ¿Estaba la orquesta a punto de empezar otro movimiento?

languages.text: その夜、ロード・キャプテンと何人かの士官は美しい音楽に目を覚ます。その調べに心を癒やされるように思えたが…音の源は、自分たちの体であることに気づく。歯はスタッカートを刻み、腱は透明な手に弦のように弾かれる。そして、見えない吐息が骨の中を吹き抜け、悲しげなフルートの音を奏でる。幻想は終わったが、その後も長いこと、動くたびに心臓が恐怖で飛び上がる。もう一度このオーケストラは演奏されるのだろうか？
languages.original_text: That night, the Lord Captain and some of {mf|his|her} crew were awakened by beautiful music. The sound seemed to caress their very minds... until they realised that the source was their own bodies. While their teeth were chattering out a staccato, their tendons were being plucked like strings by unseen hands, and invisible breaths flowed through their bones, turning them into mournful flutes. The illusion ended, but for a long time afterward, every movement made their hearts stutter in fear — was the orchestra about to strike up once more?

traits.locale_text: その夜、ロード・キャプテンと何人かの士官は美しい音楽に目を覚ます。その調べに心を癒やされるように思えたが…音の源は、自分たちの体であることに気づく。歯はスタッカートを刻み、腱は透明な手に弦のように弾かれる。そして、見えない吐息が骨の中を吹き抜け、悲しげなフルートの音を奏でる。幻想は終わったが、その後も長いこと、動くたびに心臓が恐怖で飛び上がる。もう一度このオーケストラは演奏されるのだろうか？

languages.text: In jener Nacht wurden der Lord Captain und ein Teil seiner Crew von wunderschöner Musik aufgeweckt. Der Klang schien förmlich ihren Verstand zu liebkosen ... bis sie erkannten, dass ihre eigenen Körper die Quelle der Musik waren. Während ihre Zähne ein Staccato klapperten, wurden ihre Sehnen von unsichtbaren Händen wie Saiten gezupft, und körperloser Atem strömte durch ihre Knochen und verwandelte sie in traurige Flöten. Die Illusion endet, doch noch lange danach erzitterten die Herzen der betroffenen Crewmitglieder bei jeder ihrer Bewegungen, aus Angst, das Orchester könne wieder einsetzen.
languages.original_text: That night, the Lord Captain and some of {mf|his|her} crew were awakened by beautiful music. The sound seemed to caress their very minds... until they realised that the source was their own bodies. While their teeth were chattering out a staccato, their tendons were being plucked like strings by unseen hands, and invisible breaths flowed through their bones, turning them into mournful flutes. The illusion ended, but for a long time afterward, every movement made their hearts stutter in fear — was the orchestra about to strike up once more?

traits.locale_text: In jener Nacht wurden der Lord Captain und ein Teil seiner Crew von wunderschöner Musik aufgeweckt. Der Klang schien förmlich ihren Verstand zu liebkosen ... bis sie erkannten, dass ihre eigenen Körper die Quelle der Musik waren. Während ihre Zähne ein Staccato klapperten, wurden ihre Sehnen von unsichtbaren Händen wie Saiten gezupft, und körperloser Atem strömte durch ihre Knochen und verwandelte sie in traurige Flöten. Die Illusion endet, doch noch lange danach erzitterten die Herzen der betroffenen Crewmitglieder bei jeder ihrer Bewegungen, aus Angst, das Orchester könne wieder einsetzen.

languages.text: Cette nuit-là, {mf|le|la} seigneur-capitaine et son équipage furent réveillés par une splendide musique. La mélodie semblait caresser leur esprit... jusqu'à ce qu'ils se rendent compte que leurs propres corps en étaient la source. Pendant que leurs dents jouaient un staccato, leurs tendons étaient pincés comme des cordes par des mains imaginaires, et un souffle invisible passait entre leurs os, changés en autant de flûtes funestes. L'illusion prit fin, mais chaque mouvement effectué dans les temps qui suivirent leur faisait craindre le pire : l'orchestre allait-il reprendre sa symphonie ?
